Article.Title: Duke Energy rates rising 4.8% on June 1 for Asheville, eastern NC ...
Preview: Duke Energy will raise rates by 4.8% beginning June 1 for residential customers in Asheville, Raleigh and eastern North Carolina. It's an interim rate hike while regulators decide on a three-year, 18.7% increase.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Cooper pushes back on bills to weaken North Carolina's climate ...
Preview: Gov. Roy Cooper urged business leaders at a conference in Raleigh Wednesday to help resist legislative efforts to slow the state's clean energy efforts.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy execs questioned on rate hike for eastern NC ...
Preview: Duke Energy executives faced questions from state regulators Thursday on their plan to sharply hike electricity rates in eastern North Carolina and the Asheville area.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Risky heat days are increasing in the Carolinas — and that's bad for ...
Preview: Tuesday's temperature hit the upper 80s and low 90s across the Carolinas, giving us a preview of things to come this spring and summer. As average global temperatures rise with climate change, so do the number of dangerously high heat days. And with that comes health risks, especially for those with health problems and people who work outdoors or in hot environments.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Climate action is mayor's priority in Boise. What could Charlotte ...
Preview: I was in Boise, Idaho, last week for the annual conference of the Society of Environmental Journalists. I came back with a head crammed full of information, story ideas and insights — like how a city smaller than Charlotte or Raleigh, in a red state, is pushing to meet climate goals.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: NC regulators delay new rooftop solar rules as a fight continues ...
Preview: North Carolina is getting ready to overhaul how owners of residential rooftop solar panels get paid, including reducing what Duke Energy pays for excess electricity sent to the grid. But it won't happen as soon as expected.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Catawba College is one of the first US campuses to go carbon ...
Preview: Catawba College in Salisbury, North Carolina, says it has cut energy-related emissions on campus and is now carbon neutral, in part by claiming credits for investments in clean energy elsewhere.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Another climate threat: an increase in 'fire weather days' | WFAE ...
Preview: Climate change doesn't directly cause wildfires, but it does create the conditions that make fires more likely. A new analysis of weather data by Climate Central shows that as the planet warms, the number of fire weather days is growing nationwide, including North Carolina.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Italian EV charger company picks Charlotte for US headquarters ...
Preview: alpitronic, an Italian company that makes ultra-fast electric-vehicle charging stations, says it will locate its U.S. headquarters and service center in Charlotte and create 300 jobs.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Gaston County lithium mine may not start production until 2027 ...
Preview: Piedmont Lithium, the company that wants to build a lithium mine in northern Gaston County, says the mine won't open until 2027 at the earliest because of permitting and other delays.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Hearing will consider Duke Energy rate hike in eastern NC ...
Preview: State utility regulators will begin hearing expert testimony this week to help them decide how much Duke Energy should be allowed to raise electricity rates in eastern North Carolina and the Asheville area.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: NC House passes bill to delay energy efficiency rule updates ...
Preview: A bill that would block updates to North Carolina's building code and energy efficiency rules passed the state House of Representatives Tuesday, with some changes.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Warm winter cuts energy use and sends Duke Energy profits lower ...
Preview: Duke Energy's profits fell 6% during the first quarter compared with a year ago as warm winter weather reduced energy usage.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Federal grant lets NC dam removal project move forward | WFAE ...
Preview: The project will restore 549 miles of watershed, protect the habitats of endangered aquatic species, and help the Cherokees reconnect to the river which flows through their lands, called the Qualla Boundary.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: As EVs fuel a rush to mine lithium, environmental concerns follow ...
Preview: Putting more electric vehicles on the roads is a critical strategy in the fight against climate change. And at least for now, that means more cars powered by lithium-ion batteries. With demand for lithium already skyrocketing, the question is: Where will it come from?
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Homebuilder makes the argument for improved energy efficiency ...
Preview: North Carolina's homebuilders are winning a political battle to block modernization of the state's outdated energy efficiency standards. The industry argues stricter energy codes would make houses too expensive. But not all builders see it that way. We talk to one builder whose business is based on energy efficiency.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Charlotte considers second solar farm to meet its climate goals ...
Preview: As the start of construction nears for the city of Charlotte's first solar farm in Iredell County, the city is seeking a developer for a second solar project to help meet its climate goals.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Atom Power plans $4.2M expansion in Huntersville | WFAE 90.7 ...
Preview: Atom Power, which makes electric vehicle charging equipment, is planning a $4.2 million expansion of its Huntersville headquarters that will create 205 jobs.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Gaston County lithium mine may not start production until 2027 ...
Preview: Piedmont Lithium, the company that wants to build a lithium mine in northern Gaston County, says the mine won't open until 2027 at the earliest because of permitting and other delays.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Shares of wood pellet maker Enviva plummet as losses widen | WUNC
Preview: Enviva, the world's largest maker of wood pellets with four plants in North Carolina, saw its stock price plummet this week after it canceled its dividend and told investors it expects bigger losses to come.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: More than half of the world's largest lakes are shrinking. Here's why ...
Preview: Human actions have caused "significant declines" in the amount of water stored in 53% of the planet's largest lakes and reservoirs. Climate change and overconsumption are the primary drivers.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Shares of wood pellet maker Enviva plummet as losses widen ...
Preview: Enviva, the world's largest maker of wood pellets with four plants in North Carolina, saw its stock price plummet this week after it canceled its dividend and told investors it expects bigger losses to come.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: NC Republicans tout 'backpack funding' for education that offers ...
Preview: A voucher bill that would let all North Carolina families get public money to cover private school tuition moved a step closer to reality Wednesday.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Did you feel it? 3.5 magnitude earthquake rattles NC mountains ...
Preview: The U.S. Geological Survey recorded a 3.5 magnitude earthquake early Sunday morning near the town of West Canton, about 22 miles west of Asheville. Sunday's earthquake near West Canton is the fifth quake to hit the area in the past two weeks.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: An alleged Russian spy whale is in Sweden — and danger. Here's ...
Preview: Hvaldimir unexpectedly headed south after several years in Norway, fueling concerns and efforts to bring him to safety. Experts say his story shines a light on how humans treat animals in general.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Company behind a digital court filing system in North Carolina now ...
Preview: The system developed and being implemented by Tyler Technologies is being blamed for wrongful arrests and unlawful detentions.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Child care providers worry as pandemic-era relief goes away | WUNC
Preview: "If there's not a plan in place at schools and they have to reduce teacher salaries, it's going to be a major hit to the field," says Kimberly Covington, the director of a child care facility in Morrisville, N.C.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Who pays for NC schools? State underfunding could shift the burden ...
Preview: State funding for school employee salaries hasn’t kept up with the cost of living in cities. Wake County Schools is struggling to keep employees, and that puts pressure on the county commission to raise local taxes.
Key.Author: David Boraks
